summary: This document is an email chain from July 2020 regarding the transfer and identification of digital evidence (hard drives) in the US v. Epstein case. It involves coordination between individuals to verify specific drive identifiers (NYCO numbers) and their upload to the Relativity e-discovery platform.

persons.name: EFTA00072660
persons.context: Appears to be an identifier for a person or system involved in evidence handling, referenced in the email chain regarding data transfer for the Epstein case.

persons.name: EFTA00072661
persons.context: Appears to be an identifier for a person or system, referenced as the sender of an email from a US Attorney's Office contractor wanting to discuss the Epstein case.

connections.description: Communicating via email chain regarding evidence handling and coordination for the US v. Epstein case.

events.title: Evidence folders identified for upload
events.description: A list of seven evidence folders (NYCO numbers) is sent out for upload to the Relativity e-discovery platform in the US v. Epstein case.

events.title: Questions about evidence drives
events.description: Questions are raised about the status and identification of specific evidence drives (NYCO24392 and NYCO24328), referencing a previous email and call.

events.title: Hard drive delivery and data set clarification
events.description: Confirmation that completed data sets were sent, a hard drive is being delivered, and clarification that some drives may be in merged folders.

keyFacts: The document reveals ongoing evidence handling and digital forensics work in the US v. Epstein case as of July 2020, after Epstein's death.
Specific evidence identifiers (NYCO24363, NYCO24392, NYCO24328, etc.) are referenced, indicating a structured evidence tracking system.
The evidence was being prepared for upload to Relativity, a platform commonly used for e-discovery in legal cases.
Communication shows coordination challenges in verifying the receipt and details of specific evidence drives.
A contractor from the US Attorney's Office (USANYS) sought to discuss the case, indicating ongoing investigative or prosecutorial activity.
